Reviews.Author: Chris Bunting "Chris"
Reviews.Content: This is really good NVR software. It isn't plug and play, so you must have some knowledge about setting up an NVR and the basic settings, but for $50, this beats $5000 software packages out there easily. It does everything you can think of, really. The android and iphone apps work great on my ipad and android phone. Support is excellent, the author keeps the software updated every few days!

Reviews.Title: Impressive Software.
Reviews.Author: Past time
Reviews.Content: I bought this software to use with a Dahua IPC-HDB3200C/2.8 2MP HD Security Camera. It offers great features and I've been very impressed with how well it works. I've been using it on a Windows 7 (64 bit) computer without problems. You will however need several gigabytes of free space if you're planning to record very much surveillance video. Nice job Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly capable software at a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: D. Gardner
Reviews.Content: I am using this software to monitor two 1080p video cameras (Swann branded HKVision OEM units purchased as a two-pack from C***co.Only about 25% of the i5 CPU capacity of an intel Haswell NUC is required to monitor these two cameras. I set up the software to record a clip when motion is detected in the defined regions, and to email me a couple of summary photos for each motion event. Works great. The one technical question I had was answered quickly and correctly by customer support. The software has a internal web server for in-network or external camera and clip viewing by browser, and also has a nice android app, and an iphone app which I did not try. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Software Review
Reviews.Author: Abram Brown
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Did much more than I had expected.Better more complete software than Securview software! I would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: no help
Reviews.Author: "Kat"
Reviews.Content: hook up was not as easy as it says..and when I called for help...got some lady that barely spoke english and the back round noise was so loud I could barely hear her...horrible...still not working...very frustrated.

Reviews.Title: Breathed New Life Into Old Cameras
Reviews.Author: LoveThatRonWhite "avidreader"
Reviews.Content: We'd about given up on getting the old bullet cams to straighten up and fly right, but this software has them ticking right along.  For once, it's not brain surgery.  We've read about this product for a while now, and finally took the plunge.  It's everything they say it is.  Home security for everyone!

Reviews.Title: Software works as described
Reviews.Author: Ivan R Nausley
Reviews.Content: Much better to monitor and record events than using the web interface for camera itself.  Easy to install and setup, was up and running in 10 minutes.  Only have two camera connected at this time, and works great.  Not sure yet what will happen when I add 10 more.  Time will tell.

Reviews.Title: foscam
Reviews.Author: james wilson
Reviews.Content: this is a great product to control cameras with.  I find it difficult to use, I am lucky that my son knows a lot about computers and programming, he got my system set up.

Reviews.Title: Joe from Miami
Reviews.Author: Joe Navarro
Reviews.Content: This was so easy to set up and use.  There are options I still haven't used.  I'm recording 4 cameras at the same time. 3 are IP cameras and 1 is from a TV tuner.  Highly recommend it...  Especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Blue Iris software Great!
Reviews.Author: Jim Morgando
Reviews.Content: I purchase this software and a FosCam from Amazon and it works great. No issues at all.I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome program, no need to pay ADT monthly fee for security, great customer service
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Hello all,Firstly, I want to point out that this is a "real" review, not something posted by an employee at Foscam.  While I was personally not able to set-up all of the cameras with this software, an employee named "Judy Rose" was able to take my computer over (via Teamviewer) and get everything rocking.  Judy Rose also helped me download an app on my phone that allows me to check on all of the cameras via 3G.  I am very pleased with the purchase.  Don't hesitate to call their customer service!

Reviews.Title: Took me a while to fgiure out
Reviews.Author: Gamer7 "seekyr"
Reviews.Content: The alarms settings are very sensitive so even though nothing is there I am still getting alarms for movement....Also instructions were pure heck to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Jessi
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly. Easy to set up and use. Does everything I expected and more. Would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Video Surveillance
Reviews.Author: greatyou
Reviews.Content: This software and the hardware is not easy to setup and the documentation is not thorough enough for an average person to use.  It doesn't provide enough installation and troubleshooting procedures when the device is not working as expected.  I was able to get it working, but some of the features/functionalities of it I was not.  Recommend the vendor supply youtube videos on how to configure and use this device along with the software and hardware.

Reviews.Title: I see you....
Reviews.Author: charles vamos jr
Reviews.Content: Having never used this type of software it took me a little bit to learn what was going on. Got the camera loaded in and messed with some settings,  and I was in business.They also have blue iris for Android to see your cameras.  That took me a little more messing with songs to get working than the original setup.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: Really full featured product.  I have 5 cameras and was able to get it up and running within an hour - there are just so many options that you have to work through the help guide.  I would recomend this with the Foscam cameras.  The nice thing is once you identify the type of camera you have (and they have a lot identified) the different features such as pan/tilt worked great.  You can also set the program up for the web so that you can log into your network remotely and view your cameras.  The IPhone version was a purchase but again works great - cost met $5.00 but worth it.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Software-Love it
Reviews.Author: SHANNON SNOW
Reviews.Content: The software does a great job and is simple to install and configure.No Problems so far motion detection and all the value of a very expensive DVR system.

Reviews.Title: Good DVR software
Reviews.Author: Brian Gray
Reviews.Content: Intuitive, feature rich, reliable, inexpensive.Doesn't always follow settings exactly, like dictating frame rate for cameras, but basically, pretty solid.

Reviews.Title: great surveillance software for the price
Reviews.Author: W. Lin
Reviews.Content: i have been trying to figure it out how to use this software for the past two days. it's a very powerful software that's capable of doing lots of things. once you get used to it, actually it's fairly easy to use. I linked it with my two foscam camera and it worked great. great product for the price

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Fox II
Reviews.Content: Was originally just using the software that cam with my FOSCAMs, but quickly came to realize that software didn't hold the mass amounts of features I wanted to utilize.  This software fit the bill perfectly.  Although it wasn't extremely difficult to setup, I did find some of the options a little confusing as to what they were really doing.  I also had to play around with the record on motion features until I could get them where I like.  Otherwise so far it is a great product, and appears to get updated frequently which I appreciate.

Reviews.Title: Ok for now
Reviews.Author: Wilo
Reviews.Content: It's doing what I wanted but it's a bit difficult, also still have to buy the serial for full version although I taught, once you purchase a cd it would of been in the package.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding, highly capable, incredibly stable, feature righ software all for only $50.
Reviews.Author: Schundg "Schundg"
Reviews.Content: This software is simply the best.  It is unbelievable that this software costs only $50.  The capabilities included in this package is beyond you reasonable expectations.  Have an idea about what you would like to see in the software, no problem, write the developer and it could be included in a future software release.  The software is extremely feature rich and is updated by the developer often.  The support for this product is provided by Ken the developer and I have experienced none better.  Simply Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: DVD
Reviews.Author: John S Frost
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the software DVD split while removing from package.  I believe the DVD material was weak causing it to split. My friend who uses the same material speaks highly of the content. Once I receive a replacement DVD I will write another review

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: David P.
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to compare it to but it works very good.  Was a bit complicted to initially setup and I have not set it up to get remote access yet but I like the way it works and I seem to get updates often which I think is a good thing as they are always doing improvements.

Reviews.Title: The software isn't really needed for the cameras.
Reviews.Author: W. Byrd
Reviews.Content: I have the software, but it really isn't needed.  The Foscam cameras allow you to save recordings to a FTP server or an SD card.  If you have some tech know how, you can bypass the software.  I'm running it on a WHS v1 box and it is a little buggy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: great software
Reviews.Author: Nael
Reviews.Content: it is doing what it is supposed to do. it updates regularly for free. it saves files of recordings and follows the schedule I set.

Reviews.Title: BlueIris
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excellent program.  Does everything I wanted and more.  Actually E-mails JPG and MP4 video to my assigned email address.  Got to tell you, Ken with BlueIris company, responds rather quickly with solutions to tech questions too.  Love the remote viewing of streaming video from home while on the road traveling; excellent date/time security for numerous cameras.  Enough for now.

Reviews.Title: Great software
Reviews.Author: Jason Mayer
Reviews.Content: This product is great.  I use it to record 24 hrs a day, 1080p video, at 30 frames/sec, currently only one camera.  It handles this easily.  However, it does use up a good amount of CPU power.  I originally had this running on my 2k8 server, but it was so resource-intensive, that users weren't able to even log in.  I have this running on its own small micro ITX server, and its working great.  With a little port forwarding, I am able to view my cameras, and the motion triggers, from anywhere.  Also, Its great that it will split the video into a new file when motion is detected.  This saves a lot of time (however, I've had one occurrence when motion didn't set off a trigger).Summary:Pros:Works great, never crashedhandles 1080p video finehas a built in web-servermotion triggers split the video into a new fileCons:A bit resource-intensivemotion almost always is picked up, but not always.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Excellent Software. Updated regularly and works flawlessly. I have seen software that does not work as it is supposed to but this one is great.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Shawn Drillen
Reviews.Content: For the money it's a very comprehensive program.  Lots of cameras to choose from.  Able to auto update software no charge.

Reviews.Title: great for device management
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: very configurable and fairly easy to use...if you have a dedicated machine to manage your surviellance this product is a good buy for the money.  it seems to get fairly good support from the developers and supports a wide variety of cameras

Reviews.Title: Great program
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. Palencia "Ron Palencia"
Reviews.Content: I ended up purchasing this from the manufacture's web site because I needed it fast and they offered a download option.Cons: This software is a bit awkward to use for the initial setup and the help system is not as good as it should be.  For example, after clicking the tiny "+" button in the main screen you are presented with a multi tabbed screen with options such as General, Video, audio, PTZ, etc.  To add the camera you must select the video tab, then select a radio button called IP then click a configure button to select your camera from the list of manufactures.  After that you can select the various other tabs to set up the camera.  They should really have a wizard to do this.Pros: once added, all my camera's worked perfectly without any extra configuration.  The web service makes remote monitoring easy.The best feature is that it can run as a service in the background.  This means that even after a power failure as long as your PC or server can power back up (Most BIOS's allow for this) you monitoring will continue.Bottom line: I recommend this purchase

Reviews.Title: Feedback correction
Reviews.Author: Al Cantarini
Reviews.Content: i left negative feedback for this company. But after emaiing the seller I stand corrected!I will now see if this software works well as I have found the software key.

Reviews.Title: Works Well for Me
Reviews.Author: Randy L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I have a 4 camera home system and it works well.  It does take some computing power to run smoothly especially with the higher resolutions and frame rates that are in use with my setup.  The video processing is processor intensive as others have mentioned.  It ran well on a high end Intel Quad but not well on a medium dual Intel.  Memory usage did not seem to be much of an issue with 4GB or more but the processor pegged on the dual.  A bit of a learning curve on the software but response from email support was fast.  Note - install with virus software disabled!

Reviews.Title: Great software
Reviews.Author: A. Hastings
Reviews.Content: I have been using ip cameras for almost 2 years and have tried the software that came with the cameras and some of the freeware software only to find them lacking in features and not always compatible with different brands of cameras. Blue Iris, however works with all my cameras seamlessly. I am able to view and push alerts to my iPhone, iPad, and use my Kindle Fire as a remote viewing device. I would recommend though using this on a dedicated PC. It seems to run much smoother when I do that, plus if you open a port to the public you are only exposing that particular machine. I am very happy with this software and the apps both on the Apple and Amazon app store for mobile devices.I recently ordered a PTZ camera and will update my review with how that works soon.

Reviews.Title: blue iris
Reviews.Author: Ralphy007 "Rafael D Ortiz"
Reviews.Content: works great and has great picture quality now I can surveillance my home from any where and that's a plus

Reviews.Title: Big Learning Curve
Reviews.Author: Cynthia B. Goodwin
Reviews.Content: I have been learning this program over a period of the last four weeks.  It is exactly as advertised.  Although it may be a bit difficult to identify what ports and settings to use, the information is out there.  Cam-it, the unofficial Blue Iris web site has been a big help.  What I like about this program is that you can use different cameras with the software.  The program is updated regularly; the developer seems to take an active interest in making sure all of his users are given the information necessary to be successful.  With the new direct to disc recording feature, the CPU is under less stress.  The cost of this software for the non-professional user is very good compared to other software that charge by the camera and is geared towards the professional user with one brand of camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome CAM
Reviews.Author: Garron Cotham
Reviews.Content: For the money, ease of configuration, installation and features, this little CAM  has to be one of the best on the market.  We've just completed installing one at one of our remote offices and it continues to impress especially with the BlueIris software.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds All Expectations
Reviews.Author: Rodney
Reviews.Content: The Foscam camera's have exceeded all of my expectations. Great product for the price and when combined with the Blue Iris software makes a great home security system.

Reviews.Title: works great and easy to use
Reviews.Author: keith pumilia
Reviews.Content: it works well . I just have to leave computer on for it to work . But no problem. Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use
Reviews.Author: G. Madden
Reviews.Content: This is a very handy little tool to keep an eye on things at remote location. I use it at my second home to check on at random times throughout the week. Don't be afraid of it, very easy to set-up and use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent software.  lots of functionality.
Reviews.Author: SkincareCEO
Reviews.Content: Excellent software.  All the instructions are in the help button so go there first.  It took a little bit to become proficient with the software because it has so much functionality.  I'm running a FOSCAM 8910W.  btw, I have the software running on Windows Home Server 2011 since it will run on Server 2003 which is the backbone of WHS 2011. Highly recommend this software.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Blue Iris software
Reviews.Author: Glen L. Snyder
Reviews.Content: Have used this software before and it is great especially for motion detection recording. Like the way it buffers so you can get frames recorded just prior to the motion being detected.

Reviews.Title: this software rocks!
Reviews.Author: Colby Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I really love this software!  I have purchased 3 licenses from them already.  The controls and ease of use is fantastic.I havent played with many different companies camera software, but from what I have seen with Blue Iris, I would find it hard to believe that any other software can compare to this software for the price.  For controlling POE PTZ Cameras it is a breeze.  A little learning curve on how to set up the PTZ, AUDIO or IR On Off, but after you understand what is what...its a breeze to add onto.Blue Iris has a massive number of compatible camera companies as well.  There must be over 150 supported cameras.all in all i love this software, and it does everything i could imagine i would ever need it to.

Reviews.Title: Does everything I need
Reviews.Author: K. Kandell "kandeka"
Reviews.Content: The ability to adjust motion sensitivity and size works good for me having cats.  The archiving of videos works good too, which I sent directly to dropbox so they are safe from a thief stealing my computer.  I have 4 cams, 3 of which at one house and one at another. I have all four in Blue Iris which is nice.I really can't complain about the software except that I would like to be able to install it on more that one computer to view the same cameras. One computer at home to record motion and one at work just to view. But the license is only for one install.

Reviews.Title: Amazing liitle eye.
Reviews.Author: christopher waters
Reviews.Content: Of all the 1000.00 dollars I have spent for security in my home and business I never knew this reasonably priced IP CAM does the job of all 4 with a dvr.  This is a money safer for those looking to watch while away. I will be ordering a few more of these for sure

Reviews.Title: IpCam Software
Reviews.Author: 4rest
Reviews.Content: This software if easy to configure and use. It has a background footprint that doesn't drag your machine down. Good for small to medium applications. I use it on about 6 cameras. Reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Does everything
Reviews.Author: J. Loveman "renaissance man"
Reviews.Content: I got the "non-foscam" version from the blueiris website and it is amazing. I have set up multiple cameras with motion detection to capture alert videos and snapshots and it works great.I was even able to hook up an external script to notify my home automation software when the camera detected motion. And there's so many parameters to accept reject motion that it allows you to tune out "false positives" and get great detection. I also use the built in web access to observe the cameras remotely.Using my google drive, I was also able to make sure that stills and video were sent to the cloud so that even if the the computer were removed, I would have access to the data.All of this comes at a cost however -- which is complexity! It's pretty tricky and time consuming to get it all set up and tuned up -- depending on how much of the functionality you want to turn on.

Reviews.Title: Program, large and capable
Reviews.Author: Belyndae Johanningsmeier "Online Marvel"
Reviews.Content: It is larger than what I thought from the picture. It is more than capable of monitoring the inside movement from specific rooms within my home, with it able to do 64 cameras. Well worth the investment

Reviews.Title: Excellent tool for camera management
Reviews.Author: S. Luinski "Ravage"
Reviews.Content: The learning curve on this software can be a bit steep but I love all the customizing it allows. Others have had great success using many wireless cameras but I find they are a significant drag on my network. Blue Iris adds to the network load since it is fetching information from the cameras constantly. Running Netflix to my Kindle and a couple users viewing cameras remotely while running Blue Iris will cause things to stop working. This is a limitation of my router (AT&T; 2WIRE). The alerts to my phone and email are such a comfort and work very well. The motion sensor triggered recording works great with high customization potential. I love this software but you should keep in mind the abilities of your personal network for running many cameras through it. I've been running the program non-stop for a week now and it runs without a hitch in recording. That can't be said for some other experiences I've had. I am limited by how I use my cameras and network so I probably can't run more than 4, but am very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent program DVR
Reviews.Author: carlos salazar
Reviews.Content: A well designed program.Easy and complete handling of the cameras.With many features to manage the cameras.Recommend purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Software
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Mendenhall
Reviews.Content: Works great. Macros allow you to overlay text of real time weather data. External software can trigger alert. Movie trimming and H.264 video export work great. Posting movies and images  to dropbox or google drive  is handy if you decide not to use included web server.. Have not tried mobile android or iOS apps.

Reviews.Title: perfect budget home DVR solution
Reviews.Author: quietconundrum
Reviews.Content: I have a multiple Foscam camera setup and have used Blue Iris on a spare PC to act as my DVR and notification manager. It records to a 1TB NAS on the network and handles all the alerts, scheduling, sensitivity/contrast programming and event monitoring. This was the best additional purchase I could have made to compliment my Foscam cameras. If you want more sophisticated control over your Foscam cameras and features that far exceed what the camera has to offer via its included firmware, stop hesitating: buy Blue Iris.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: R A D
Reviews.Content: These cams are excatly what I was needing takes some effort to set up but if u ever set up a wirless router its the same thing. I gwt snapshots and 10 clips to my phone and email while im at work throughout the day when set them to motion senser. Even inside when my dog moves around. Telling me friends

Reviews.Title: blue iris 3
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: it is very good software, it is very flexable to adapt to ones needs. it updates as it goes and commucates in many ways to keep you inform on your status, very expandable it meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Some things work others don't
Reviews.Author: BB Indiana
Reviews.Content: First, this software is complicated and I'm an Electronics Tech.  You need networking experience plus specific camera smarts.I have a mixture of 8 IP cams and one USB cam and got them all to somewhat work on Blue Iris (people in the forum call it BI).  What I like is my older Foscam FI8910's seem to work with all the features I want. I chose NOT to use the webserver and just use it to monitor the cams at home for security, because the Foscams have a built in webserver that I can access and control the cameras from my Smart Phone (Android) or most any other web browser anywhere you have Internet access. So... I don't use the webserver part of BI.The problem I'm having is my new Foscam Fi9821w's 'almost' work but not 100%.  I can't get the preset's to work which is also reported in BI forum.  The presets are important because if you move or pan the camera any masking you have setup will need to be changed unless you have a functing preset button to get you back.  I can activate zones and have it snap pictures or make movies when someone goes into a selected zone in the picture which is pretty nice.  The pan features work in BI and the Image on the computer looks better than the camera's web interface (in both IE10 and Firefox 19)  and allows for software zooming before the pixels visually fall apart, a nice feature.So this software is like my new Foscam camera and is nice but just isn't finished. Hmmm, perhaps they are both.... naw, they couldn't be related.Most of you should just stick with the web Interface that came with the IP camera unless you really want to tackle this riddle.  Perhaps a new update just for the Fi9821w from Blue Iris and also I need one for the 9821w camera from Foscam...

Reviews.Title: Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.
Reviews.Author: PghDrake "PghDrake"
Reviews.Content: This software seems to be fickle. Not sure that it's a flaw in the programming or what, but I've tried over and over to get it working, I've looked through countless form posts, tried several different techniques for configurations, and although generally I can get it to work, it seems to only work for a while before I have to start over. I'm using this with the same model camera pictured on the front of the box, I've tried it with Windows 7 and Windows 8 both.-D

Reviews.Title: IP Software that works
Reviews.Author: PJDSR
Reviews.Content: It took a couple calls to tech support to get some of my cams figured out, but after they logged into my computer remotely and set one of them up...it was a piece of cake. Very nice software, though you do have to be somewhat 'techy' to get features operating like remote viewing from the internet or a cell phone...tech support will be needed to get you through that!

Reviews.Title: Nice features
Reviews.Author: Dan Buckley
Reviews.Content: I bought the software to go along with a couple of Foscam cameras we bought to monitor our home. The software works very well and it's easy to add additional cameras to it when it's time to expand. I only use Foscam cameras so I can't comment on it working with other brands, but I don't doubt that it could.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: shkrbkr03
Reviews.Content: Picked up 2 of these cameras when they were on sale. 1 for the nursery and 1 for the basement. This allowed us to have a baby monitor and keep an eye on the dog while we are away from home. The CD that came with the camera makes set-up a breeze. Recently orderd 2 more. The functionality these cameras have at the price is hard to beat. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great people and very helpful
Reviews.Author: bridport7
Reviews.Content: These people installed cmers and Blue Iris and did a great job. They do it fast and it always seems to work tim morris really did a fantasic job!!!!

Reviews.Title: Main Screen additionals
Reviews.Author: Surveilzon
Reviews.Content: Foscam Blue Iris Professional: It would be even better if the IR on/off, audio-in (listen) on/off, audio-out (talk) on/off, gain (video and audio), focus, brightness and contrast controls were easy control buttoned on the main view screen similar to the zoom and directional controls, instead of being a hassle, mouse clicking and searching on a drop down list. There's a lot of room for more buttons on the bottom portion of screen next to the directional, zoom and preset. Quickness (less movements) in utilizing controls is a major factor enjoyable and convenient with surveillance. The zoom button should have the magnification "x" number shown so the viewer and recorded screen would know said magnification being viewed. Also buttons for record speeds, play, pause, reverse, slow/frame advance/reverse, fast advance/reverse, a window for playback with all mentioned controls while still showing other windows in real time would make it 5 star plus.

Reviews.Title: Works Fine & many usefull features
Reviews.Author: R. Ordowich
Reviews.Content: The software installation was easy. Configuring the camera took a bit of time to discover where the network connection parameters were. Once those were configured, the connection was made. Setting up the web server took some time to get port forwarding configured but that is not a problem with Blue Iris but with the way routers and firewalls are too convoluted.Recording works fine and the options to delete older recordings to save space is great. Remote access via a PC or IPhone works great, good quality video.The software has been stable so far. Doesn't crash or use up too many resources.

Reviews.Title: It works great
Reviews.Author: J. Pabst
Reviews.Content: From what I've used of this it has always done well for me. However, I mostly use the Foscam app on my iPad, so I probably would forego buying this if you plan on using an app. However, this software does allow you to record for extended periods of time - whereas the app does not.

Reviews.Title: For home, this is FANTASTIC!
Reviews.Author: Bubs
Reviews.Content: As a facilities manager with a mix of SD and HD cameras at work, I knew the costs involved in trying to create a home based security camera network. At first, I was a bit leery of going with Foscam, but after reading reviews I decided to take the chance. I am so glad that I did.  This software is really about the best you can get at the price, no more need to be said on that.  Yes, it can be quirky and needs tweaking from the user end but it delivers.  I am so pleased with my Foscam setup and it didn't "break the bank" which was my goal. I was able to set up my initial installation, download the app on my phone/iPad, and take a relaxing vacation while checking camera operations when I wanted: while literally a thousand miles from home.  Talk about peace of mind!!!! Now I am saving pennies to purchase some of Foscams HD cameras to add to my personal security network.

Reviews.Title: Blue Iris
Reviews.Author: Darrill B. Litherland
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to go along with our Foscam cameras and it is doing a marvelous job. It allows you more flexibility than the software that comes with the cameras such as recording and scheduling.

Reviews.Title: software
Reviews.Author: E. Lyda
Reviews.Content: This software is very versatile and easy to use. It offers things usually not available, such as the ability to make a phone call with an alert rather than just the typical text or email, which it also does.

Reviews.Title: Non-compatible software
Reviews.Author: Jillian Walker
Reviews.Content: It just did not work and no one was able to  provide a good solution. It did not worth the effort.  in I am returning the product for refund.

Reviews.Title: No communication..Zero.
Reviews.Author: ColoradoWildFlower
Reviews.Content: I bought this software to monitor my house area outside.  After paying $50 I put in the disk and setup the program.  When I setup the camera to the software I was happy that I could see part of my house.  But what baffled me was that there was a gigantic banner across the whole screen area so you couldn't see much.  This after already paying $50??  I saw that to register you have to give them the numbers etc.  So I put hte numbers in that were given to me and the next button would not light.  The only way to go forward was to either choose the "one camera" edition or "multiple cameras" edition.  Either one you have to pay another $50 or so.  So I wrote to Foscam per email and thru AMazon to try and get help.  No communication.  Not even thru the original email going directly to the company.  And that was a few days earlier during the work week.  Finally I rec'd an email thru Amazon that was just a man asking what number I had.  So I sent him what he asked for and then again, no communication!  No email at least saying sorry for your problem, or I'll write you back today or whatever.  So bad communication and so the Zero for everything!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: anishap
Reviews.Content: I was using foscam software and I thought of purchasing this based on some of the reviews. But I made a mistake, it doesn't worth the money.  I guess the advantage is if you have different branded cameras operating at the same time. Foscam software is easy to setup and use.

Reviews.Title: Great for Cheap IP Cameras
Reviews.Author: J. Williamson "JBW"
Reviews.Content: To control cheap IP cameras like Foscam and Wansview this software is great. Even if you have no programming background Google searches can get you the info needed. I have a programming background and had the software up and running in under an hour. I highly recommend you change the default web server port from 80 as any one scanning blocks of IP's could potentially be watching your cameras if not super secure. This $49 software makes cheap cameras better and well worth the expense of an old computer. I run mine on an old throw away dual core machine with 4 gigs ram and push 6 IP cameras with no problems.

Reviews.Title: This product works great
Reviews.Author: d.c. "dave of ca"
Reviews.Content: I've got a few ip cams and had been using free apps like yawcam (which is pretty superb, but couldn't stick with because it's only good for 1 cam) and iSpy (kept cutting off for some reason), so when I ran into limitations with these 2 I checked out Blue Iris, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Ney Camargo da Cruz Filho
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 cameras and I didn't want to buy a VCR to store do moves recorded. So I started to looking for a way to do it without buying a new equipment. When I saw the Blue Iris, I thought that it was perfect for me. Now I can manage all the cameras, store the movies, send alerts and more. I would recommend this software.

Reviews.Title: Blue Iris Take 2
Reviews.Author: Louis G. Baron "iblouie"
Reviews.Content: Amazon is doing Great...Ordering is easy, Tracking is a snap, Products are delivered on or Before the delivery date,all that is GREAT!!As for Blue IRIS, I expected that when I paid $49.95 to purchase the product, that I would get the full product.The packaging appears to be the retail box and inside it contains the software and PRODUCT KEYS. Theproblem is that when I load the software and enter the Product Key, I am taken to a screen that wants me toenter my Credit Card Information and apparently BUY IT AGAIN!!!!  What is up with this????I sent a email to the contact folks a Blue Iris but as of this writing have'nt heard back...it has only been a coupleof days so far. This looks like a 15 day Demo item, complete with NAG lines through the screen!!!!!The above is my initial review...after a few hours of trial and error, the ANSWER to the question of "Did I buy the real thing?" is yes.Evidently in their dash for the cash, Blue Iris decided that:1. The Product ID you enter MUST be in ALL Caps.2. You MUST put in the dashes between the five sets of characters.3. Either 1 and 2 are correct or else Blue Iris takes a Day to make sure they have  their dough before granting access.All in all, this was not too bad...of course I did have a Backup Piece of software or two that wasworking, but for "normal" folk, I am sure they would appreciate just a couple of lines that tell youEXACTLY what is required to activate the software.So far the software is working fine and I am relatively content. Thanks.PS  I still have not gotten a reply to the email sent to the Blue Iris "support" folks.

Reviews.Title: Extends the functionality of my cameras
Reviews.Author: P. Coon
Reviews.Content: This was a good addition to my Foscam cameras.  Although the cameras come with their own software, this has more flexible scheduling, allows you to choose from 4 different video recording formats, and enabled me to set up a web page on my computer that I can access from work.  Since I'm not video tech savvy, some of the functionality is over my head, but the Help is pretty good.The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because it's a bit of a resource hog.

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your $$$$
Reviews.Author: Steve_M
Reviews.Content: Purchased this with a foscam camera based on it being recommended by Amazon. It is pretty much useless, The Foscam camera is great, Their app does everything blue iris does but blue iris based on what i read makes it easier and can do more...bull!It was not easy to work with. After following their procedures it worked but when i opened blue iris the next day it only showed a test paatern. The biggest pain is if you want to use it remotely you have to pay $9.99 for the app. The foscam app is Free and works well. You can also get the tiny cam app for FREE and that will let you up load to dropbox. I see blue iris as a useless program and if i ccould i would return this P.O.S!

Reviews.Title: Blue Iris Professional
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: There no booklet to help you with setting the software up.  I couldn't find but ONE youtube, it wasn't helpful enough.  You really should have a instruction manual, with the software.

Reviews.Title: Software doesn't work as expected.
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A Johnson
Reviews.Content: Difficulty getting the software to work appropriately with our network.  This was a gift and it is very disappointing that it still doesn't work correctly.

Reviews.Title: No Idea If It Works
Reviews.Author: D. Dahlbeck "Tappah"
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how well this works because when i arrived the sticker was stuck to the bottom of the disc, making it impossible to use.I knew something was wrong from the second I picked up the package and could hear the disc loose in there.Seems like some really poorly designed shipping/storage and I will not be giving them a second chance.

Reviews.Title: One fatal flaw for me...no multi-camera streaming audio
Reviews.Author: mseanmcgee
Reviews.Content: Blue Iris has lots of good features, however, it has one fatal for me... no streaming audio for multiple cameras.  The whole reason I purchased several Foscam cameras and the Blue Iris software is for use as a monitoring tool for multiple kids rooms. I intended to run the iPad client in our room at night so we could see and hear multiple kids rooms. However, Blue Iris only supports audio streaming when you are watching a single camera. As soon as you stream 2+ cameras, audio streaming/monitoring is not supported.  So, I can "see and hear" one kid or I can "see" multiple kids but I can't "see and hear" multiple kids.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie Smith
Reviews.Content: I did not like it, could not figure it out  so I sent it back what more can I say I don't like it

Reviews.Title: $50 trial version
Reviews.Author: Jayman
Reviews.Content: Description mentions nothing of this being a trial version. Very disappointed to say the least. 15 days to try then spend another $50 for a license. No thanks plenty of other third party software out there to try for free.Using security monitor pro and pretty happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up
Reviews.Author: W. Woods "ww woods"
Reviews.Content: Others warned how hard this is to set up as far as remote access.  The tech was great, but it took them at least an half hour of taking over my computer and getting it working.  after a few weeks of working fine it just stopped working remotely.  What a pain!!!!

Reviews.Title: Does what I want and their customer support is great
Reviews.Author: Gene Waldvogle
Reviews.Content: This is the software that should come with the Foscam cameras, and is probably suitable for other cameras as well.  The interface is well thought out with tons of features that provide control over when and how each camera is recorded.  I have only had it for a month but they have already added a couple of great features - like being able to set different "hot zone" masks for each of the PTZ presets on a per-camera basis which allow me to mask out tree movement at each of the settings.  Even if you don't have Foscam cameras, there are lots of other manufacturers supported and it seems very likely that you will be able to find settings for yours.  Don't hesitate to contact their support with a pre-purchase question or 2 - my experience has been that they reply within a day and have always been able to answer my concerns.  If all software was supported like they do it, there would be far fewer bald men in the world.

Reviews.Title: Sill haven't gotten the wireless to work consistently
Reviews.Author: Me2Be "Picky Purchaser"
Reviews.Content: I bought the software, 3 outdoor FOSCAM cameras, and one indoor camera with 2-way audio and video.  We were able to set up the cameras while connected to the network using cables.  We then, after considerable time (roughly 3 hours of trial and error), were able to get two of the cameras to show up wirelessly.  We then tried to move the cameras where they would be positioned full time and lost all of our wireless connections and were unable to get them to connect wirelessly again.  Everything is sitting in boxes now until we have several hours to spend trying to troubleshoot and figure how to make them work again.  It's not easy.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Great Software
Reviews.Author: Sandy H
Reviews.Content: I just set up several cameras at my house to watch our pets as well as surveil the front door because of some recent incidents in our neighborhood.  I found this software worked right out of the box and there was some setup required.  For a beginner with no network experience, this might take a while.  However, once you learn to set up your cameras and have their network information, this software works great.  In fact, it has so many options that I am still learning how to use them all.  But for basics - detect motion and record, snap a picture, send an alert, etc - this software works great.  For an expert in this field, they may find something missing but for a home user needing this type of software, I think you will have a hard time finding something this powerful for the price.  Yes, I tried some free stuff but they always wanted money to do something more.  So, for this product, I am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Took many hours to configure
Reviews.Author: Ken Dreger
Reviews.Content: This product took many hours of trying different configs to get it to work the way I expected it to.

Reviews.Title: Great Surveillance Software. Wish it had a few more features
Reviews.Author: JVelvet
Reviews.Content: For the money, this software is fantastic. It supports up to 64 cameras, and is very easy to set up. I have mine running on an old Dell laptop that I just use exclusively as my security camera DVR. It is great.I wish that it had a few additional features though:1) Remote Administration (via web page)2) Support for 2-way audio.3) Ability to download video clips remotely.Other than that, I haven't found anything else that I really need it to do. I am very happy with this software.

Reviews.Title: Buy It Now!
Reviews.Author: dmbTank
Reviews.Content: I have been an IP based camera user since the early days, and have used IP based Camera software since 2003.  I tried the high end software costing tens of thousands, the leaders in the market but could never afford it.Blue Iris fills the gap between non-affordable with a BlueIris feature rich affordable solution at a price you simply do not want to miss out on.BlueIris supports a majority of IP based cameras and have selectable drop down options, My 9 year old camera was listed as a standard config setting - awesome. More importantly, I upgraded to newer technology, and had the pleasure of setting up the camera in BlueIris with no issues for multi stream with ePTZ.BlueIris supports Motion Detection, alerts, email notices, alarms, digital out, Network Drive with playback, timelime and a host of other higher end features.Recommended as a home based IP Camera Monitoring Solution.Go get your demo today and be convinced... TrueToad.com

Reviews.Title: did not need it with foscam camera, but came in package
Reviews.Author: Wyobabyface
Reviews.Content: didn't need this to make camera work, actually tried to use it at first with foscam camera and couldn't get it to work, took it to staples and they tried it also, then tried it without...didn't need it!!!

Reviews.Title: Marv's cam
Reviews.Author: Aliene Watson "A"
Reviews.Content: After receiving the product I have to tell you I was a salesman until I retired and never working with my hands the task before me was tough.I followed the instuctions and with the help of a very friendly tech.I have the system up and running.It works great am I am very pleased.  Marvin WatsonFoscam Blue Iris Professional - Supports Many IP Camera Brands Including Foscam and Agasio, Zone Motion Detection, H.264 Compression Recording, E-mail And SMS Text Messaging Alerts!

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Wade
Reviews.Content: The camera works very well, and with the blue iris software makes a very nice inexpensive monitoring system.  I like getting a text pic of UPS dropping off my packages.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: The Blue Iris software is everything I expected and more. I have no complaints. It made it very easy to set up all the cameras and view them remotely.

Reviews.Title: this is great
Reviews.Author: tomcat3
Reviews.Content: Blue iris was easy to load. not overly difficult to operate, i should have bought this with the first camera instead of the last 2. tech support is great if you need it, did not need on software, but did on a camera, and they are the best! Foscam is producing great quality products. Amazon is doing a great job with fulfilling their orders. you cannot go wrong with this team.

Reviews.Title: Supports Foscam cameras
Reviews.Author: Ozark Crafter
Reviews.Content: I did not give it 5 stars simply because it is not as simple to use as I expected.  It seems a bit too daunting with so many setting options for a novice who just bought their first IP camera.  It does work as far as I know from only using the software a short time.

Reviews.Title: NO customer Sevice  Blue Iris
Reviews.Author: G. M. Williams
Reviews.Content: Bought this to set up 3 different types of cameras in one place. The help page says contact Ken if you have a problem with IP cameras. I set up two of my cameras OK. But there was no drivers for the IP cameras inside the software. So I sent off an email to Ken at Blue Iris. He blew me off. He said he was only one guy and that I should contact The geek squad at Best Buy. Unless you are a geek then don't try this at home.  Its a shame that the software seems to work , if you know how to set it up. There is also no Apps for Android or I Phone which was promised in the adds on Amazon. Of course I cant send it back as software is not refundable. Buyer beware!!!

Reviews.Title: active number dont work
Reviews.Author: chun kang
Reviews.Content: activation code inside the cd but that activation code dont work so i called fascam they say there responsible .....i talk to both company so i pay another 49.95and work okay but not much differance free softwarei think there is not much free software market thats why this company and fascam charge this muchnot worth

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: T. Meadows "TM"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic feature rich software, love it!  I have had it running all week with my 5 ip cameras with no issues.  Super easy to set up and works great!

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend.
Reviews.Author: TekGuy
Reviews.Content: In over 20 years working IT, I admit I don't take the time to review much software, but this really annoyed me.I wanted to catch which of my cats is peeing on the rug.Have a decent IP cam and wanted to setup something to catch them.Maybe it's because this is a Demo, but I certainly am not impressed.I tried using motion triggers and it seems promising, but when it counted, the software did not come through. 2 wet rugs, no video. A few video and single stills, but not even close to consistent.Even tried just having it record...good luck with playback.Getting the Free product Zoneminder. My bet is it does the job much better.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely worthless
Reviews.Author: Animal Doctor
Reviews.Content: Rule #1 in buying software: Don't ever buy from a developer who doesn't list a phone number for support; there's always a reason they do this. Company only has an email address, and have emailed them twice in 5 days without a single response. Set this up using a PC with 2GB memory, Netgear 7000 router, range extenders, signal boosters.  and 21 cameras, 9 of them Foscam. Cameras kept loosing connection to the software daily, finally had Foscam's excellent customer service remotely view my settings on cameras, router, and software. They verified everything was set up correctly and could not provide a reason for the continual loss of connection. I am currently looking at the Blue Iris screen over my LAN which shows 3 cameras working, and the other 9 read "No Signal", "check IP address", "I/O error", "socket error", and so on. Simply put, this software is garbage, there is no support available, and it doesn't work. It did, however, convince me to go to a wired system. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS.

Reviews.Title: Very difficult to use
Reviews.Author: Janel Campbell
Reviews.Content: I found this camera very difficult to install and I'm not ignorant to technology and computers, etc. I have a degree in computers and still couldn't get this camera to work properly. I did NOT like the fact that you have to do port forwarding, and set up a DNS account ,etc. Thumbs down on this product. I have other IP cameras that are simple to install and use. No thank you..

Reviews.Title: No support for the updated version
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I installed and in the process it initiated an update.  After the updated install the software stopped working.  I called support department; they said why did you upgrade? (really)  As per instructions they told me to uninstall. which I did, as I re-install the software it goes through steps of installation and reaches the end.... then does an automatic uninstall. (nice)

Reviews.Title: USELESS and not reliable
Reviews.Author: Scorpion
Reviews.Content: CCTV systems are used for critical purposes and sometimes play a major role in crime investigations, so failure is not an option here.I got this one hoping to get the mentioned "quality" but was surprised that most of the time, it halts, doesn't record, and you just go away depending on it and once you come back, I just know that you are screwed up!!Totally not a reliable software, be away.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY!!
Reviews.Author: njlax32
Reviews.Content: Purchased this online expecting an email with my registration code or at least an order confirmation but nothing for 4 days and counting. My credit card was charged immediately. There is no phone number and I have sent three emails to their tech-support but nothing. Doing some research to get a phone number I find out that there domain name blueirissoftware.com is registered as private?? Why would a legitimate business do that? Now I have to contact my bank and dispute the charge. HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: NOT LICENSED AS ADVERTISED
Reviews.Author: Al Arruda
Reviews.Content: DIDN'T GET LICENSE FOR THE $49.95 PRICE. SOFTWARE DEMANDED ADDITIONAL $49.95 FOR A LICENSE WHEN "TRIAL" EXPIRED. ASKED FOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT BUT RECEIVED NO SATISFACTION.

Reviews.Title: No license key after 3 days
Reviews.Author: Juan Osorno
Reviews.Content: I am giving it only one star simply because Amazon and Foscam have failed to provide a license key. I have called Amazon and Foscam and they are giving me the run around. Finally Amazon said they were going to refund the cost and I am to return the software.It has been a total waste of time buying this. How can they ship a DVD case with no license key?Otherwise, software seems to be ok.

Reviews.Title: Missing digit from key code, software is useless without it.
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Blue Iris software is the best.I have the trial software and bought this for the key code .BUT, The code which was obviously hastily printed is missing the first letter or number , I am not sure as they started the print off of the label.No plastic wrapping.Totally useless without the key code which is what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: PC Only
Reviews.Author: Lie2me
Reviews.Content: Blue Iris is PC only.No Apple Mac Version here.EvoCam4 by Evological is Mac based and tested to support the following Foscam cameras:FI8905W, FI8908W, FI8910W, FI8918W, FI8919WFI9820WFI9802W, FI9821WFI9821W V2They say EvoCam may support a zoom feature. However, they have yet to test it on the Fi9826.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't work well with Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Davion
Reviews.Content: This is crap and I should have sent it back after I realize that I didn't buy the actual ip camera. I didn't pay close attention that it was just the software. Here's my problem. The software doesn't support Windows 8.1 and I can seem to find an update for it. It works fine on Windows 7 but there is an update feature that I haven't installed because when I did the last time, it froze the application. What a waste of $50 bucks. Not worth it. The cameras work great. Once you get it working, it does a fairly decent job.

Reviews.Title: Not user friendly...
Reviews.Author: Designer Amy
Reviews.Content: It's just not as user friendly as it should be nor does it work as smoothly as I would expect.

Reviews.Title: NO REMOTE ACCESS
Reviews.Author: Daniel Gardner
Reviews.Content: No remote access through this program to your cameras unless this program and your computer are left running, which leaves your computer open to hackers and all sorts of other stuff.

Reviews.Title: Expend weeks to set it up, gut to and expert on puzzless, after 45 days I din't finish undertand all software intent
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: I have the impression that if is bought direct from FOSCAN will be treatment will be better, no helpnothing intuitive for setup your wireless camera in to your WI-Fi, have to be connected thru you original camera softwarewas ready to returned, but my curiosity stop me, have some good thing's but not happy with Blue Iris

Reviews.Title: Standard PC DVR software
Reviews.Author: A. Lovegren
Reviews.Content: I assumed that this software would have the same features to control a FOSCAM FI9821W as the software that came with that IP camera. I was wrong. I like that I can view & record feeds from different cameras and the software is easy to use. I store feeds off site and can setup individually,Other than looking at multiple feeds at once, this software does not offer much for my use.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Bob Daniels "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this cam! for any purpose!I use mine as a caregiver watching and listening to my elderly mother.

Reviews.Title: Foscam wireless camera
Reviews.Author: D. Howard
Reviews.Content: Nice camera with a pretty good picture. It was easy to set up and get connected to my wireless network. This makes it convenient to place anywhere in my home with power nearby. The camera works good with my Android phone and I'm able to check in during the day. Night vision works decent when the lights are off and I can make out enough detail to check on the house when we're out after dark. The camera is good without any added software. It is pretty simply to get it working with my email accounts so I can get email alerts after motion is detected.One downside is after the camera re-boots it goes into a patrol mode and usually pans up and stays locked onto my ceiling. After I adjust the camera aiming it stays put.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product and Support
Reviews.Author: foyetog
Reviews.Content: *UPDATE* - I am quite impressed wight he product.  Takes a bit of patience and experimenting to get it running smooth but a powerful application.  Have 7 cameras running on it with tons of features.  Updated regularly and few bugs.I bought the software several days ago to work with my new cameras. In order for the software to monitor the cameras, it requires an update. All well and good but their website has been now down for 5 days, the support is unresponsive and basically says they are in vacation. I am about to return it.

Reviews.Title: It is ok.
Reviews.Author: rodrigo
Reviews.Content: I think it is not record the tenvis camera. I need more instruction for use the software. thank you. bye.

Reviews.Title: No remate access
Reviews.Author: C. Lambert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product and the android app so I could remote view with my phone. It works fine on WiFi, but I have spent two days with no luck following the online instructions for IP forwarding. The email alert will have to work for now. I would give this 5 stars if they had live support.

Reviews.Title: Not Straight Forward
Reviews.Author: Aaron A. Allen "AAA"
Reviews.Content: It would be nice to have installed the software and given it my router info and had it do an auto setup.  This is not the case.

Reviews.Title: Way way way too complex!
Reviews.Author: E. Solch
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get it to work for me. Bad thing is on the trial it took up all my time fiddling with the interface trying to configure my camera's. Now I find I have to buy a license...won't be doing that. Waste of money and time!

Reviews.Title: Not support for installation
Reviews.Author: Manuel Chavez
Reviews.Content: I try to install it I called service support, they did not know much about the program, not helpful at all.When you call for help, you have to wait for them to call you back so you are tied for hours waiting.

Reviews.Title: Very Basic
Reviews.Author: Brown Trees
Reviews.Content: Not quite what I was expecting...very limited and then they teased with the "Professional" upgrade. Not worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: the software requires administrator permission
Reviews.Author: Just-Artifacts "a-customer"
Reviews.Content: It is ridiculous that only computer administrator can uses the system. We usually do not use administrator account unless it is really necessary.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!  NOT MAC COMPATIBLE
Reviews.Author: Chris Fisher
Reviews.Content: Despite reading many reviews I missed the fact that this reportedly excellent product is not MAC compatible. This was not clearly part of the product listing nor did I see it in a review.

Reviews.Title: Not used
Reviews.Author: Steven L.
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it....havent been able to get camera to work wireless. No use for it yet.So I have no real experience with it.

Reviews.Content: If there were an update to use Blue Iris with Windows 8 I'm sure I would be able to use the software.
